title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 203.4 - Investigation and hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 203.4 - Investigation and hearing

State Regulations
(a) The
board shall direct an investigation of any questions raised by the application
and such objections to the application as may be filed with the board. In
conducting such an investigation, the board or its agent may require affidavits
or direct a hearing. If a hearing is directed, the board or its agent shall
prepare and cause to be served upon the applicant and any party a notice of
hearing before the board or its designated administrative law judge at a time
and place fixed therein. (b) In the
event a hearing is directed, the provisions of Part 212 of this Chapter shall
govern. Notes

203.4

New

York State Register August 2, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 31, eff. 8/2/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
